title: Open now FAIL
text: why does it still show me a bunch of closed restaurants when I s elected the Open Now filter?  Unfortunately TINA at present.

title: Needs safer controls
text: I’ve been way to close to accidents because the app doesn’t re-center automatically. Honestly I don’t even know how it gets off-center but it should definitely reset. So annoying! I can’t be fiddling with this while driving. Aside from that it’s great but kinda fuming right now.

title: Update messed up intuitive functioning
text: I’m irritated that it is not working with iPhone now I click on it from the browser after the update and now it just goes to the App Store like I never had it downloaded. But it’s downloaded so it says open but when it opens it doesn’t pull up the address. I had to stop at a stop sign for a while trying to get it to work until I had to result to just putting the name directly in the app and hoping it pulls up the same address because it didn’t pull up the correct address when I just typed in the name. I had to go back and copy the addy… toooo much work!

title: New springs etc
text: My tech Drew explained everything about my garage door & what it needed to work well again.  He was very polite & professional.  Job was done promptly.   Thanks,  Drew

title: Google maps are the worst!
text: I haven’t use Google maps since about six years ago when I was going to my cousins on Christmas Eve and was giving me directions that were three hours or more and it was only 45 minutes away. Needless to say I never use the map from Google I use my Apple Maps and everything was fine.

title: Stop changing route!
text: I quit using google maps on my last trip. There is a reason that I choose the route I want to take before I leave.  I cannot have it changing my route while in route. It’s absolutely ridiculous to give me several routes to choose from and then change it to the one I did not choose!

title: Google
text: So interesting to use .

title: Flimsy birthday arrangement
text: My daughter paid a hundred dollars for a flower arrangement for my birthday. She ordered online and expected the beautiful arrangement with a variety of flowers and succulents which  she ordered to be delivered to me, her mother. Instead of the arrangement she ordered a very small half-dead arrangement of left over green carnations from St Patrick’s Day with a couple of other flimsy flowers. I would discourage any online floral service from ever using Creative Designs by Jim. There was nothing creative about the arrangement I received!

title: Works but i’ve had accessibility issues for a long time
text: Firstly I love Google and the app works fine when updated and opened. I just want to clarify that but several other things have bothered me for years and need to be addressed. For one, the application is very controlling when you try to search an address without the app open. If I even start to Google an address it will take over my phone and force me into the application or the application store to update for use. I can’t even think about getting directions without complete loss of control of my phone which leads me to my next point. Almost EVERY single time I need the directions and am forced into Google Maps the application needs an update. When I need directions, I need directions because I have somewhere I need to be. For instance, today my job was to pick someone up from a location. I got lost and when I googled the directions it immediately took me to google maps without a choice and I had a FIFTEEN MINUTE update (only option) I would have never made it to the customer if it wasn’t for a third party application. It’s unacceptable.

title: ADDS HOURS TO TRIPS AND PERSONAL HARM
text: Google Maps is dangerous. On a cross country trip it added about 20+ hours to the trip, endless frustration, damage and wear on the car, and personal injury. It reroutes without asking and made terrible choices to go on the biggest busiest highways and take us to the back of National Parks! It even routed us off a highway directly onto a unpaved road. With misplaced confidence my partner slammed into unmaintained road, injuring us and both our dogs while damaging the suspension and tires. Needless to say it took a well planned and dreamed up trip and turned it into a dangerous mess. I am burned by Google for the last time with bills and injuries from their greed and lack of functioning apps. Bye Google! Not gonna miss you!

title: Mr. Randy McBrewer  - Culligan Water
text:
First and foremost, Mr. Randy McBrewer displayed the highest level of professionalism. He’s easy to talk with in regard to the system that one may have in their home. He’s very thorough and conscientious with his work. I might add he’s very detailed also. 

I’d recommend him to anyone having their quarterly service. You won’t be disappointed!!

Joe Spigner 
Terrell, Tx.

title: Sound for Driving Direction?
text:
I have an Apple iPhone 11pro. There is no adjusting the volume for directions with the buttons. I have to go to another app to watch a video to changed the volume settings. Google or Apple haven’t figured it out yet?

Pictures disappear on each place I click on.

title: Stop rerouting me without permission
text: When i select a route option, it’s for a reason. VERY often the maps decides, without notice or permission, to change my route after I’ve made my choice. This app used to be better than Apple maps…. But not so much anymore bc this frustration is extremely annoying! And stop asking me questions while Im driving! Do you WANT me to wreck? Seriously Google. You can do better.

title: Plz understand direction alternating roads
text:
New review:
Done. When you route me straight into traffic when I thought we were going the [open] toll way, I’m furious beyond belief. I get it, you don’t understand DC’s confusing toll systems, but when you have people driving down them (and I know at least 1 of these 1000 cars do), please understand that is the way I want to go… and once I get on it, don’t keep trying to reroute, thinking that I’m driving backwards on a toll road. I’m not. 

Previous review:
Why can’t I simply copy an address? I get the special coordinates, or if it’s a location I get the location name. Furthermore, what’s the point of multiple stops on my journey, if after the first stop I lose the route because my closed for 5min? This is after stepping out on my first stop for gas, rest station, or store. That defeats the whole purpose of this feature. Have some sort of memory, please.

title: Why I love Google Map so facking much
text:
Hi Google Map, I’m Mary Pig. I outdone like to share my insights bout u.
U see, u are not a bot

title: Excelente atención y buenos precios
text: Me pareció excelente el servicio la atención fue al máximo, la higiene de la clínica excelente y algo que también me gusto es la ubicación de la clínica..

title: Not Reliable
text: I think it is mind boggling as much as Google invests in AI and how long Google maps have existed that Google maps cannot do a simple reroute without bringing me through a one street school zone with one lane for a red light. It turned my route into an extra 30 minutes for no reason. Sometimes I think this company just gets money from oil execs because it wants to waste your gas. Good lord get it together

title: Long Gold Standard but No More
text: Google Maps has now repeatedly given my routes that are over an hour slower than the quickest route. When forced to give the quickest route by adding stops Google Maps confirms there are much quicker ways. Quickly becoming  useless app.

title: It’s not as useful as it once was.
text:
Bring back avoid neighborhood. It’s not the r word, it’s just rude to send cars through a neighborhood street. Especially when there’s a perfectly serviceable freeway or highway that can be used instead. 

Stop auto rerouting to “save time”. My route changes so much between when I leave the house and get to a destination, it makes it difficult to follow directions and makes me concerned when I think the turn is in five miles but Google says turn now.

title: Go to app for a GPS and Location Locator
text: Really the go to app to go for anything map related.

title: Do not use!
text: I moved across the country and this map application made it completely horrible. It didn’t know about a major bridge closure and it took me through extensive construction areas, it had me drive to Virginia through little town roads in Kentucky through insane mountain twists and turns instead of using highways and interstate roads. Twice it had me turn off the road I was on to take another road and then had me turn around and go back to the road I was on. A move and a cross country drive are stressful enough without a map app that makes it as miserable as possible. I wonder if the developers thought this was a fun joke. I deleted google maps from all of my devices and I want to warn others.

title: PROBLEM
text: Overall I am very pleased with your application. But there are a few problems that just drive me crazy. The first and most important problem is when you need to update the application, it doesn’t talk about it... but starts to work BADLY and doesn’t work fully... I just start to get mad about this and at these moments I just want to sue you. The remaining problems are not so important.

title: Put direction arrow back on Home Screen
text: Please put the direction arrow back on the Home Screen of the app

title: Please add a REROUTE button
text:
I have to agree with the person from TorontoOH and also ask for the PAUSE button. I mean seriously to figure that someone using an app like this is only going within a bladder’s length of time - you’re smoking crack. It is quite annoying to have (as the person from TorontoOH coined it) “Miss Yip-Yap” in the middle of emptying the bladder shout out where you should be going and multiple times, is enough to switch to a different app. 
   The second button that needs to be placed on this app is a “REROUTE” button or a “take me a different way” option.  Too many people willing to cause too many crashes added to the ever increasing traffic jams mix in some construction and you’ve got a severe need to find a different path.  Right now if I take that open lane to the off ramp Miss Yip-Yap is more than happy to guide me right back into the thick of the traffic jam.  Yes I know I can switch off the highway option but when the detour is on a side road turning off the highway option is not going to help since I was never on the highway.  I simply need a different route or better yet just get me around this jam. Parades and street parties happen far too often.  Thanks

title: Seize the Bay Fishing Charters
text:
Tim was an excellent captain!  Very helpful, patient, and knowledgeable.  He got right back to me about my questions before the day of
our charter. He was a lot of fun and seemed excited when we were successful at catching fish. And we caught LOTS…speckled trout, snook, redfish…came home with LOTS of filets.  Tim filets it right after the charter. We were VERY satisfied with our 4 hour charter and would definitely do it again!!!  Thanks Tim!!

title: Updates?
text:
Update after update after update and it NEVER seems to get any better.

How ‘bout letting the road names get better as you zoom in so we can actually READ THE WORDS?

How ‘bout Create a custom route and a save custom route upgrade? G-Maps doesn’t always find the “best” route around traffic, accidents and construction or toll roads.

How ‘bout letting users (who’ve already given you all their personal identifying information for you to sell for your profits) view business posted images without having to create a Yelp account (so they can sell our information for their profits).

title: Super good

title: Show the Proper State Highway Signage
text: Unlike Apple Maps or Waze, Google Maps neglects to show the proper state highway signs.  For example, the State route shield in California is the shape of a green miners spade (in honor of the Calif gold rush) with white numbering.   On Google maps, you’ll just a generic white oval with black numbering.

title: Charles Adams
text: Mr. Sal Zambri is an exceptional lawyer. I consider him the GOAT of injury lawyers. It took 6 years to get Justice for our son. And he was with us the entire way with patience kindness and understanding. He is extremely professional and knowledgeable about injury law and great at explaining complicated legal stuff to laymen and laywomen like us. We could not have gotten through this agonizing ordeal without him. I would give him 6 stars if I could. May God bless him and his law firm. Again he is the Greatest Of All Time of Injury Lawyers and I have no reservations about recommending him to anyone, including all of my family and friends.
